page.title: 02SHOTESHAM/HOWE ECOLOGY
page.content: The area is designated as a{ {CONSERVATION}one which directly affects the planting and removal of trees and hedgerows. Species in hedge_ rows: Wild rose, sapling elms, maple, hawthorn, spindle, holly, ivy and oak. { CLIMATE}is relatively dry but is subject to cold N.E. winds. There are no bridleways but there are many{FOOTPATHS}with as many as five meeting at one point. These are walked regularly. There is much established{WOODLAND. There is one area which has been planted with a variety of trees and which has been allowed to grow wild allowing small animal life and wild flowers to flourish. Species of flora: Orchids, early purple, marsh, spotted pyramidal, fragrant and greater butterfly. Cowslips, bullrushes, bog pimpernel and yellow arch_angel.
